Abstract window interface. This is implemented by the different backends, which can be found under aglet/window/*.

This also implements an dispatcher for async events in the library. The one built into Nim isn't really built for soft realtime usage (like games), so the one implemented in aglet is as simple and lightweight as it can get.

Imports

gl, input, state, target

Types

WindowHints = object
  resizable*, visible*, decorated*, focused*, floating*, maximized*, transparent*,
  scaleToDpi*: bool
  colorBits*: tuple[red, green, blue, alpha: int]
  depthBits*, stencilBits*: int
  stereoscopic*: bool
  msaaSamples*: int
  glVersion*: tuple[major, minor: int]
  debugContext*: bool

Window hints. For most hints, if a backend does not support them, they should be ignored.

  Source Edit 
AsyncCallback = proc (): bool {...}{.closure.}
Callback for async polling. The value returned signals whether the callback should fire on the next pollEvents or waitEvents.   Source Edit 
Window = ref object of RootObj
  agl*: Aglet
  pollEventsImpl*: proc (win: Window; processEvent: InputProc) ## polls for incoming events and passes each one to ``processEvent``
  waitEventsImpl*: proc (win: Window; processEvent: InputProc; timeout: float) ## waits for incoming events and passes each one to ``processEvent``
                                                                       ## stops waiting after the given timeout if it's not -1
  pollMouseImpl*: proc (win: Window): Vec2f ## polls the OS for the mouse cursor's position
  makeCurrentImpl*: proc (win: Window) ## makes the window's GL context current
  getProcAddrImpl*: proc (name: string): pointer ## returns an OpenGL procedure's address
  setSwapIntervalImpl*: proc (win: Window; interval: int) ## sets the buffer swap interval (vsync). 0 means no vsync, 1 is the
                                                    ## monitor's refresh rate, 2 is half the monitor's refresh rate, etc.
  swapBuffersImpl*: proc (win: Window) ## swaps the window's front and back buffers
  setCloseRequestedImpl*: proc (win: Window; close: bool) ## requests that the window gets closed. This should set or unset a "close
                                                    ## requested" bit in the window
  closeRequestedImpl*: proc (win: Window): bool ## returns the "close requested" bit
  iconifyImpl*: proc (win: Window)
  iconifiedImpl*: proc (win: Window): bool
  maximizeImpl*: proc (win: Window)
  maximizedImpl*: proc (win: Window): bool
  restoreImpl*: proc (win: Window)
  showImpl*: proc (win: Window)
  hideImpl*: proc (win: Window)
  visibleImpl*: proc (win: Window): bool
  getSizeImpl*: proc (win: Window; w, h: var int) ## stores the window's dimensions in w and h
  setSizeImpl*: proc (win: Window; w, h: int) ## sets the window's dimensions from w and h
  getFramebufferSizeImpl*: proc (win: Window; w, h: var int) ## gets the window's framebuffer size
  getContentScaleImpl*: proc (win: Window; x, y: var float) ## gets the content scale of the window (for hi-dpi support)
  setSizeLimitsImpl*: proc (win: Window; min, max: Option[Vec2i]) ## sets min/max size limits
  setAspectRatioImpl*: proc (win: Window; num, den: int) ## sets the window's forced aspect ratio
  resetAspectRatioImpl*: proc (win: Window) ## disables the window's aspect ratio limit
  setTitleImpl*: proc (win: Window; newTitle: string) ## sets the window title
  setPositionImpl*: proc (win: Window; x, y: int) ## sets the window's position
  getPositionImpl*: proc (win: Window; x, y: var int) ## gets the window's position
  keyStates: array[low(Key).int .. high(Key).int, bool]
  mousePos: Vec2f
  asyncCallbacks: HashSet[AsyncCallback]
  gl: OpenGl
A backend-independent window. This also contains the OpenGL context, so resource allocation is done using this handle.   Source Edit 
Frame = object of Target
  window: Window
  finished: bool
  Source Edit

Consts

DefaultWindowHints = (resizable: true, visible: true, decorated: true, focused: true,
                    floating: false, maximized: false, transparent: false,
                    scaleToDpi: false, colorBits: (8, 8, 8, 8), depthBits: 24,
                    stencilBits: 8, stereoscopic: false, msaaSamples: 0,
                    glVersion: (3, 3), debugContext: true)
  Source Edit

Procs

proc IMPL_makeCurrent(window: Window) {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Do not use this. Makes a window's context current. You should not use this in normal code. This is left as part of the public API, but it's an implementation detail left in because of global state.   Source Edit 
proc winHints(resizable = true; visible = true; decorated = true; focused = true;
             floating = false; maximized = false; transparent = false;
             scaleToDpi = false; colorBits = (red: 8, green: 8, blue: 8, alpha: 8);
             depthBits = 24; stencilBits = 8; stereoscopic = false; msaaSamples = 0;
             glVersion = (major: 3, minor: 3); debugContext = not false): WindowHints {...}{.
    inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Constructs a WindowHints with sensible defaults:
  • resizable: true
  • visible: true
  • decorated: true
  • focused: true
  • floating: false
  • maximized: false
  • transparent: false
  • scale to DPI: flase
  • color bits: (red: 8, green: 8, blue: 8, alpha: 8)
  • depth bits: 24
  • stencil bits: 8
  • stereoscopic: false
  • MSAA samples: 0
  • GL version: 3.3
  • debug context: when -d:release is not defined
  Source Edit 
proc startAsync(window: Window; callback: AsyncCallback) {...}{.inline,
    raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Adds a procedure to the dispatcher loop. This procedure is fired on the next pollAsyncCallbacks call. If it returns false, it is removed from the dispatched procedures; otherwise, it will run on the next async tick.   Source Edit 
proc pollAsyncCallbacks(window: Window) {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Run all active async callbacks registered through startAsync. This is called implicitly by pollEvents and waitEvents, so usually you don't need to call this.   Source Edit 
proc pollEvents(window: Window; processEvent: InputProc) {...}{.inline,
    raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Poll for incoming events from the given window. processEvent will be called for each incoming event. This also dispatches all async callbacks.   Source Edit 
proc waitEvents(window: Window; processEvent: InputProc; timeout = -1.0) {...}{.inline,
    raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Wait for incoming events from the given window. processEvent will be called for each incoming event. If timeout is specified, the procedure will only wait for the specified amount of seconds, and then continue execution. This also dispatches all async callbacks before the wait period.   Source Edit 
proc requestClose(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Requests that the window gets closed. This may not actually close the window, it only sets a bit in the window's state, and the application determines whether the window actually closes.   Source Edit 
proc rejectClose(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Resets the close request bit.   Source Edit 
proc closeRequested(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
                                        tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns whether a window close request has been made.   Source Edit 
proc swapInterval=(window: Window; interval: int) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Sets the window's buffer swap interval. The swap interval controls whether VSync should be used. A value of 0 disables VSync, a value of 1 enables VSync at the monitor's refresh rate, and any values higher than that enable VSync at the monitor's refresh rate divided by the interval.   Source Edit 
proc key(window: Window; key: Key): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the pressed state of the given key. true is pressed.   Source Edit 
proc mouse(window: Window): Vec2f {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}

Returns the current position of the mouse cursor in the window. This may be used in an input event handler to query the last mouse position.

If the window is not focused, it returns the last position of the cursor when the window was focused. If you need the mouse position when the window is not focused, consider using the (slower) pollMouse.

  Source Edit 
proc pollMouse(window: Window): Vec2f {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Polls the OS for the mouse cursor's position. Unlike mouse, this works returns the current position regardless of the window's focus.   Source Edit 
proc position(window: Window): Vec2i {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the window's current position in screen coordinates as a vector.   Source Edit 
proc position=(window: Window; newPosition: Vec2i) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Sets the window's position in screen coordinates.   Source Edit 
proc size(window: Window): Vec2i {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the current size of the window in screen coordinates as a vector.   Source Edit

Returns the current width of the window.   Source Edit 
proc height(window: Window): int {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the current height of the window.   Source Edit 
proc framebufferSize(window: Window): Vec2i {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the size of the window in pixels as a vector.   Source Edit

    tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the window's width in pixels.   Source Edit 
proc framebufferHeight(window: Window): int {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the window's height in pixels.   Source Edit 
proc contentScale(window: Window): Vec2f {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
                                       tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns the content scale of the window.   Source Edit 
proc limitSize(window: Window; min, max: Option[Vec2i]) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Limits the size of the window. This resets the aspect ration limitation.   Source Edit 
proc constrainAspect(window: Window; num, den: int) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Constrains the window's aspect ratio to num/den, where num is the width, and den is the height. This resets the size limitation.   Source Edit 
proc unconstrainAspect(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
                                      tags: [RootEffect].}
Resets the aspect ratio contraint.   Source Edit 
proc iconify(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Iconifies the window.   Source Edit 
proc iconified(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns whether the window is iconified or not.   Source Edit 
proc maximize(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Maximizes the window.   Source Edit 
proc maximized(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns whether the window is maximized or not.   Source Edit 
proc restore(window: Window) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Restores the window.   Source Edit 
proc visible=(window: Window; visible: bool) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Sets whether the window is visible or not.   Source Edit 
proc visible(window: Window): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Returns whether the window is visible or not.   Source Edit 
proc title=(window: Window; newTitle: string) {...}{.inline, raises: [Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Sets the title of the window.   Source Edit 
proc render(window: Window): Frame {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Starts rendering a single frame of animation. Only one frame may be rendered at a time. After rendering the frame, use finish to stop rendering to the frame.   Source Edit 
proc finish(frame: var Frame) {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Finishes a frame blitting it onto the screen.   Source Edit 
proc glVersion(window: Window): string {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns a string containing the version of OpenGL as reported by the driver.   Source Edit 
proc initWindow(agl: var Aglet) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initializes the windowing submodule. You should call this before doing anything with windows.   Source Edit 
proc IMPL_loadGl(win: Window) {...}{.raises: [Exception, OSError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Do not use this. Initializes the OpenGL context. This is called internally by backend-specific constructors.   Source Edit 
proc IMPL_getGlContext(win: Window): OpenGl {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
Do not use this. Returns the raw OpenGL context for use in internal code.   Source Edit
